alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 8:34PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Fayette County through 930 PM CST... At 834 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm winds along and outflow boundary along a line extending from near Dime Box to near Waelder. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... La Grange, Schulenburg, Flatonia, Fayetteville, Round Top, Muldoon, Cistern, Carmine, Swiss Alp, Dubina, Rutersville, Warrenton, Engle, Ledbetter, Waldeck, Plum, Ammannsville, Mullins Prairie, Nechanitz and Freyburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for south central Texas.
